website_summaries.verdict: Customers like the low profile of the socks. Work great for preventing pain and applying compression.
pros: Multiple colors available to provide a little style
Helps prevent ankle twists and sprains
Owners say they can wear these socks all day and night comfortably
cons: Some owners report the socks wear out after a handful of uses
As socks age, they roll up when putting on shoes

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, immense comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered from Plantar's Fasciitis for years, I've used orthotic insoles, orthotic shoes, and injections. While these all work quite well, they are very expensive. My doctor advised me to try the compression socks. I purchased these ones and they live up to their word!!! I get so much relief from these socks so i feel so much better than usual at the end of day. They are beyond comfortable and true to size. The company shipped them quickly, i received them within a couple of days of ordering.
customer_reviews.author: nangarcia

customer_reviews.title: One Big Problem
customer_reviews.text: When i originally ordered these socks back in March of 2017 i liked them, but after wearing them for several months i have changed my opinion. There is a problem especially if you wear socks over them. The bottom edge is not hemmed so when you put on socks over them the edge curls up and rolls back on you foot. This is uncomfortable and creates pressure on the lower foot when you walk or run. Otherwise these socks feel good on the arch and ankle and provide mild support.
customer_reviews.author: jamie21

customer_reviews.title: Only worn 4 times
customer_reviews.text: This product is great except for poor construction. I have 4 pairs of these compression socks and have had no problems until this one. As you can see the top "trim" separated from the body of the sock making it worthless. I am 85 years old and am hardly strong enough to cause this kind of damage. Be careful, these are far too expensive to keep replacing because of poor construction. UPDATE: I have updated my review to a full 5 stars due to the companies exceptional customer service. After posting my original review customer service responded and have already placed a replacement sock in the mail for me. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but with I would have purchased a larger size, hard to get on, UPDATE: I purchased some shoes at ORTHOFEET.COM , and wearing them, has finally cured my Plantar Fasciitis!! No kidding, after wasting money on every gimmick out there to help my foot pain, I got these shoes and BOOM, I could walk pain free! Better than taping, nightboots, splints , rollers....etc. I wear my shoes from the time I wake up to the time I go to bed. Bought a pair for in the house and a pair for going out. I still do foot stretches, but no longer have the horrible heal pain.﻿
customer_reviews.author: Simnut

customer_reviews.title: Prevents and soothes most pain
customer_reviews.text: I have not officially been diagnosed with plantar fasciitis, but I have been experiencing foot pain due to increased activity. These compression socks definitely have helped to prevent most of the pain. I have thicker ankles, so they are tight on my leg, but overall the size medium are a great fit for a 8.5 wide woman's foot. I have experienced a little rolling and bunching, but not anything that has been distracting while working out. I wore them to bed once, but they were uncomfortable so now I just wear them to curb swelling and pain or while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Miracle socks for my Plantar Fascitis
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for Plantar Fasciitis relief, and oh my gosh these work great. I cant wear them for more than 12 hours though, but the relief is great. After about 10 or 15 hours of not wearing them, the pain starts to creep back, then I pop these on again for as long as I need to. The amount of time I am wearing these now instead of when I first got them is way less. They must be helping to heal the muscle not just relieve the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Great compression for medicated swollen feet
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these socks. My feet swell from my medications all the time. The fibromyalgia pain is often times immediately relived the moment i put them on. Sometimes i wear them to sleep. Compression socks don't work because they squeeze the calf. I bought this socks to squeeze my feet and they work VERY well.
customer_reviews.author: Love Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis which is a huge inconvenience. I am on my feet all day for work and I was hoping these compression socks would help relieve the pain. My shifts are often 7-9 hours with minimal time to sit down. These compression not only did not work they actually made the pain worse. The only relief I felt from these socks was when I took them off. I think my feet are pretty average in size and width, but it felt like my circulation was being cut off, especially in my pinkie toes. I would not recommend. These have done absolutely nothing for me. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kacii The Kooky Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Great pain reducer
customer_reviews.text: My ankle was severally shattered first in a skydiving accident and then in a head-on collision so I live in constant pain. I'm pending another surgery. I have tried a lot of ankle supports from Hangar braces to compression socks and have to say this compression sock has given me the most relief. It is very comfortable while doing the job of keeping my ankle attached and reducing the swelling which causes the most pain. It is not a cure-all but it gives myself a lot of relief. Highly recommend this brace.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Weise

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one pair some months ago and decided to order another set because I have found that can't walk long distances without them! when I walk long distances, my feet swell a bit and then any continued walking seems to make matters worse. These socks avoid the swelling problem. I don't need to wear them in the office; I can wear high heels at my work but on walks with my dog, exercise, travel, they are a must!! If I wore slacks at work I would wear them as well because they feel nice :-) Finally, the socks wash well, and don't seem to lose their stretch or compression.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaPhD

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot possibly love these compression socks any more than I do! I broke my ankle and had to have surgery. My recovery has been great except for swelling in my ankle and foot which was causing me pain. I put these, well just one, on in the morning and it has almost eliminated my swelling and pain. The compression is just enough...not too much where my toes go numb but enough to feel supported. These are labeled as left and right but I just wear it on my bad foot and have found them to be interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday support
customer_reviews.text: Decent and light weight. They're comfortable and help support my ankles. The only gripe I've got is when I put a sock on over them the front edge rolls back a little bit so I have to mess around with them to lay flat under my socks. I also have the Powerlix Ankle Support Sleeve which is more heavy duty (and more expensive) that doesn't have this problem. I will use these for general walking and the Powerlix for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Loscheider

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: These worked great, for literally one use. After that they started rolling and bunching up, exactly what I was worried about before puchasing, which causes a lot of pain. I can't believe I spent over 20 bucks on some socks I wore once. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but received a dirty/stained sock
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's size 7 - 7.5. These socks are very snug and comfortable. Looks like they are a good quality and should last for a while. I did not know before I bought them that they could not be put in the dryer. Not a deal breaker for me but more of an FYI for others considering buying these socks. The socks would have received 5 stars but one of the socks is dirty/stained. (see pic) And, of course, it is the white one which means it is very obvious. The socks were sealed in a plastic bag so I do not know why it is so dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks to help with PF. I really could not tell a difference either while wearing them or after wearing them. Also, the socks would irritate my feet after an hour or so, so I had to take them off. IMHO, these are a waste of money. I've since learned how to treat the cause of PF with a holistic practitioner, which is much better than resorting to things like this that only "treat" the symptoms.
customer_reviews.author: MUFC215

customer_reviews.title: Best product on the market for me post spinal fusion surgery!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for your wonderful product. I am post spinal fusion surgery. He placed implementation in my back-9 screws, 2 rods and a plate. My Right leg is weak and lazy. I began having trouble with my ankle. Shooting, burning nerve pain. I ordered you product after trolling the Internet for compression supports. I was so happy to receive your product. I use it every day to give support to my right foot and ankle. Thanks for your wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Tucker loyal reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice socks
customer_reviews.text: Nice socks. My foot is size 9 (US), but medium was little too tight for me (may be it is meant to be that tight; however it was just too much for me). So, i bought L size and it is good amount of tightness in my feet (my feet are thick also). I yet to see its effect on my plantar Faschiatis which has been acting up for last 10 months (i have had 3 steroid shots so far).
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: More Pain
customer_reviews.text: These socks just squeezed my foot, so at first it felt good, but when I took them off, my leg & toes were swollen & painful when the sock had not been. I don't see any difference where the lines are drawn on the socks, as far as I can tell, they are just spandex socks. That may work or you, for me it only led to more pain!
customer_reviews.author: Daizy

customer_reviews.title: These socks have been a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I work in a warehouse and am on my feet 8+ hours out of the day on concrete flooring and these socks have helped me tremendously! I used to suffer throughout the day when I was working from my feet hurting and now I feel nothing! I use them with regular thin socks on top of them.
customer_reviews.author: Rhaine

customer_reviews.title: and these will be very useful socks. I think this will be a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to manage compression of post-surgery swelling, weak arch, and muscle cramps (tri-malleolar fracture, orthopedic surgery, plates and screws, incisions and loads of swelling...and now that it's summer weather, I didn't want the full compression sock or T.E.D. stocking inside my walking boot). Took quite an effort to get this innocuous little sock pulled over the still swollen, stiff, tender ankle, and over the healed incision scars. Next time I removed walking boot, nearly purple toes, aaaggghhh! Physical Therapist said maybe TOO much compression for the amount of swelling yet. Wait until later, when the swelling has subsided, and these will be very useful socks. I think this will be a great product, just not quite yet.
customer_reviews.author: Phaelon Goodarrow

customer_reviews.title: Great little compression socks, but...
customer_reviews.text: These arrived quickly and I ordered them because it's always difficult to find sleeves/socks, etc in any other color save black, so when I saw the pink socks I was like "yeah". However, the socks are a bit small in sizing. I ordered the large since I wear a woman's US8. These things completely cutoff circulation to my feet and by the end of the day, my feet are in more pain than what they were originally. I ended up giving them to my 14yr old daughter, who after wearing them one day also complained that they were too tight. If you order, I would suggest going up a size.
customer_reviews.author: HiddenLotus Tarot, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on ball of foot.
customer_reviews.text: I can handle compression. I currently use the small of compression Z socks even though I am in the middle of the medium range because I like compression. Compression Z offers much higher compression overall evenly throughout the sock. These socks were too tight in the ball of foot and at the top where the reinforced bands exist. I could not take them and my foot started to cramp. However, they are not tight enough everywhere else. I had to return them. I hope this review helps you make a decision.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to get them on your feet. I cant use them. I tried .you get them on you cant them off. Or you get it on. Can I have a refund please.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: So it's annoying and uncomfortable to wear with (or without) socks
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. The band that goes at the toes continues to roll up. So it's annoying and uncomfortable to wear with (or without) socks, I'm on the hunt to fund a full sock.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Bell

customer_reviews.title: Solid Ankle Support
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. If your ankles bother you and you're certain you don't have a fracture or any other serious issues, I recommend these ankle sleeves. I'm a weightlifter over 6' and around 240lbs. I wear a pair of Nike's that provide great support when lifting at the gym, but I still wear the ankle sleeves at the gym if I'm hitting the elliptical machine or treadmill. I wear the sleeves often to compensate for the lack of support when wearing dress shoes at work. I recently tried a product named Penetrex that I rub on my ankles, knees and any other spots that are causing me pain to help in addition to the ankle sleeves..
customer_reviews.author: AtlasSub34

customer_reviews.title: I wore these compression socks and had some great relief. At the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: After having multiple surgeries on my foot in a in constant pain as I am on my feet all day and tons of walking in my doctor office. I wore these compression socks and had some great relief. At the end of the day, my feet did not hurt. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie1231

customer_reviews.title: 50+ Year old runner with Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I have had to deal with Plantar Fasciitis in one foot for months now. I tried buying new insoles which marginally helped. I run 5K to half marathons and this foot problem eventually sidelined my running. I bought these compression socks to try. I only needed one sock, so I would wear one while the other was in the laundry (even though one has L and the other sock has R). One week later, my foot is feeling much better. I quit wearing the sock after 3 weeks and I am back to running again. 5 Stars for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I wear them to bed or when I get home from work. They add a little too much thickness to wear with socks but they really help with the inflammation and soreness with plantar fasciitis. I place mine in the freezer to get cold. These are really small so you'll want to order a larger size if you wear a shoes over a women's 6.
customer_reviews.author: Fit Hot MEss

customer_reviews.title: Great Compression Socks; Very Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These quickly became my favorite brand of compression socks, after trying four other brands. The quality is very good and the price is very reasonable, especially if you buy the 2-pack. They wash well, hold up well, and are very comfortable. They also roll up less at the ball of my foot than other brands (perhaps I have this problem because I have bunions). Just about perfect. My one complaint is that they don't seem to offer them in a "nude" color. I would like a color that I can wear with my sandals and that don't stick out like a sore thumb. Unfortunately, I need to turn to other brands for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, works well with our without socks.
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. These have slightly less compression than another brand I purchased, however that could be a size/fit issue. I love these compression socks for everyday wear. They are tight (in a good way) at the top of my ankle, but not tight on my fat calf. These are comfortable and fit me well. My only complaint, is I purchased 4 pair, all in black for two different family members. I can't tell which socks belong to which family member now that I've washed them. Next time, I'll purchase different colors for different people. Not a complaint, but something to think about if you are purchasing for more than one family member.
customer_reviews.author: Football Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not sure yet
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really sure about these yet. First of all, I’m a relatively small person and they are really tight around the top (like is it going to cut off the circulation ? tight) hoping this will stretch a bit. Also, I was thinking that they’d hold my foot in a ‘standing’ position keeping the muscle stretched, thereby relieving the pain that occurs when you try to stand up and your foot flexes. I can’t tell any difference in the ‘relaxed’ position of my foot. Noted, the compression around the arch feels nice and maybe with prolonged use I will see improvement. I’ll update my findings after I’ve used them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy P.

customer_reviews.title: Helping with heel pain
customer_reviews.text: My heel pain had gotten to near unbearable. I started wearing these compression socks day and night and they seem to be helping quite a bit. They're very comfortable under socks in my sneakers. The size Large fits nice and snug. I wear a size 9.5 - 10 shoe (female) if that helps anyone with sizing. I got several two-packs so I can always have a clean pair to wear. I recommend these in addition to ice treatments and stretching for reducing inflammation. I do have a heel spur on one heel so too much time on my feet hurts, but I give credit to these socks for helping control the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi C

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Didn't help me at all with the circulation problem in my feet, weren't even close to being tight enough. I would say more suited better for people with pain or in need of support. Didn't help the blood pooling in my feet at all.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got two pairs! I love these socks so much!! Essentially I fight foot pain, plantar fasciitis, and a few other foot things. I also love running and working out. These socks help so much with the pain I normally have when running but they're so wonderful to slip on just to relax in on "rest" days. I'm so glad I took a chance on these and highly recommend the double pack so you can still have the relief while one pair is drying. <3
customer_reviews.author: SisterLilBunny

customer_reviews.title: Pain in achilles gone
customer_reviews.text: Was running one night and had a sharp pain shoot up my achilles tendon and mid calf. Thought I partially tore the tendon just a week and a half before a trail race. Got these compression sleeves for the ankle area and they did the trick. Ran the race, did not do more damage, and back on track. I mat have had some achilles tendonitis, but not sure. These work, and I would purchase them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Ski-ball

customer_reviews.title: Good for younger people too!
customer_reviews.text: Im 36 and have problems with gait, knees, feet due to the military. I thought these wouldnt work for me but i love them. Im flat footed and have plantar f. The socks immediately support my flat "arch" and changes how my feet touch the ground. My feet nolonger stomp when walking. Try these of you have ANY type of foot/leg pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My feet hurt worse
customer_reviews.text: These didn't do anything for my feet and they cut into my feet and because of that my feet hurt worse. I ordered the correct size according to the size chart.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Inserra

customer_reviews.title: Too tight but I followed the size guidelines
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing plantar fascitis socks to support my arch for about 2 months. I have tried two brands. These socks fit well but are too tight. My shoe size/ and sock size was right in between and I did not know whether to go down or up? So I went with the mediums and they were too tight. Too much pressure created pain in the arch of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I was having some issues with swelling and pain in my feet from having dropped metatarsals. These compression socks worked great. After a few weeks of wearing them, I no longer had any ball pain and my feet have stopped swelling. Try it if you have my same problem. I wore them under socks and they never bunched or rolled. The fit was perfect, not to tight.
customer_reviews.author: Countrygrl4u2nv

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my feet were swelling like cooked sausages ready to burst. Doctors couldn't figure out why and put me on BP med,s which helped everything but my feet. I bought these and started wearing them to bed with my legs elevated. They were hard to get on at first, but in the morning, the swelling was completely gone! After a week...I could wear shoes again. I told my doctors and they said great. I carry them with me now and if my feet start to swell I pop them on for an hour or so at work and voila!
customer_reviews.author: Juliana

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE, THEY ARE SO TIGHT THEY LEAVE BLOOD MARKS ACROSS THE SKIN, FEET HURT FOR ABOUT 12HOURS AFTER TAKING THEM OFF & I ORDERED EXACTLY BY THE SIZE CHART.
customer_reviews.author: rgirl

customer_reviews.title: Best support found in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I finally found toeless ankle support that does NOT have a thicker band on the foot part making it feel like there is something in your shoe, and eventually causing real foot pain. They fit really well and I can wear them all day without discomfort, and the best part is when I take them off at night, I don’t have that throbbing you usually get. If I had to write a con, it would be that they don’t come in a skin tone color so I could wear them with shorts. I LOVE them!
customer_reviews.author: marilyn d

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: I followed directions for measuring my feet before ordering - ordered a M. I wear size 7.5-8.5 shoe, depending on brand. The first few days Incould tell a positive difference in plantar fasciitis pain. After wearing daily for a week or so, the compression seemed to be excessive (regardless of which shoes I wore). The socks left imprints in the tops of my feet and began to crease/bunch under the arch. I’m not as happy with them after a couple of weeks as I was the first few days.
customer_reviews.author: George Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Great for my workout
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks are great for my workput. They fit perfectly when I ordered one size up then my normal regular size. They do not cover toes so please read and see pics carefully if you want a full coverage socks. They are providing enough pressure once you put them on. I like that the pair also has wriiten left and right on them with L and R on them.
customer_reviews.author: heer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough compression
customer_reviews.text: I need a lot of compression around my arch for plantar facetious. The arch measurement was 9" which as you can see can go either medium or large. I ordered the large and the seem to fit but the compression is just not there. I also ordered the NEO premium compression foot sleeves in a medium as suggested by their measurement chart and they have 10 times the compression. The description on these sounded like they had the most compression so I wanted to try them also. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: MabelLucy

customer_reviews.title: Great for rehabbing a sprained ankle & preventing injury
customer_reviews.text: No one can buy my review, period. I rolled my left ankle hiking on some big rocks and wore these while rehabbing that ankle. I have weak ankles and broke my right ankle several years ago while out backpacking. If this product were available five years ago, I believe it would have prevented my right ankle from breaking. I now wear it every time I go hiking to protect the left ankle and it works like a charm. It is very comfortable to wear with hiking shoes. Incredible product; I bought a pair for my daughter and am buying a pair for another family member as well. Highly recommend this product and plan to buy another pair for myself.
customer_reviews.author: NVR STL

customer_reviews.title: 100% LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy with these. They are tight but dont cut off circulation. I've broken my ankles multiple times, no arches, have extra bone issues, and I am a chef so on my feet for hours, love my flip flops. I recommend you do your part at reading reviews and using the size guide. I put them on 7 hours ago and dont want to take them off. I WILL be buying more. FINALLY found something to replace l having to wrap my ankles every night.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Allen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable! I Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently wearing these and by far for the price and comfort, these are far better that the supposedly Best Plantar Fasciitis Socks that I totally did not like. These give great support, are comfortable, and I wore underneath another pair of thick socks and then put my shoe on and these did not make the shoe tight. I wore these in my waterproof tennis shoes today as we had a snow day. Great fit. I ordered my regular size and these fit true to size. If you need compression socks for your feet, I wear on both of my feet, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Chicy

customer_reviews.title: They run a little small.
customer_reviews.text: These socks work really good the only reason i gave them 4 🌟 and not 5 is because they run quite a bit small. I would suggest ordering a size larger if you're closer to that size. For example if the med size starts at shoe size 71/2 and you're a size 7 order the medium. My grandfather couldn't use them but I've been using them and have gotten great pain relieve and haven't had any swelling at all in my feet and ankles even after standing for long periods of time. I've had serious problems with swelling for years along with unbearable pain but about a week after i started wearing these socks those problems are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Beaneez2

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Foot Support and Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: I am a server and my feet hurt so bad at the end of a shift. These socks are greatly reducing my pain level and also keeping my feet from swelling. The only problem I have is that the sock starts rolling under at the toe opening after I have worn them a few times, so I am washing them more often than I otherwise would because it seems to shrink them back up. Surprisingly, once they air/dry out after wearing, they do not smell. They must have anti-microbial properties. I also have weak ankles and I feel that these socks offer extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Redhead

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great results!
customer_reviews.text: I was beginning to get arch pain while hiking and running...almost like a stabbing feeling related to plantar fasciitis. I had sock from this same company which I love so after tons of research I chose these. I wear them all day under my normal socks and my arch pain is 99% gone while hiking. I stand up all day at work as well and my feet and lower legs feel better after just one week. I have a size 8.5-9 womens and I got a medium. They fit perfectly with just the right amount of constriction.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: A must have!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I have tendinitis and suffer with plantar fasciitis. I had a secondary ankle sprain and it's just been lots of pain ever since. These have been a great help. Moving around day to day has been challenging facing pain day in and day out until I tried these. Most days my pain is like minimum, sometimes no pain at all. I even drive in these because they help a great deal cause I find driving is very painful especially in traffic and they're so comfortable that I sometimes forget I have them on. These compression socks are a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Being M G

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for me
customer_reviews.text: This really did help ease the pain in my feet and the planter fasciitis. At times I swell up and get edema in my legs and feet. This prevented swelling in my feet but caused excessive swelling above the sock Because it was compressing the foot and Ankle and not the leg. I had purchased compression socks at the same time and those have proved invaluable I love them. They also help with the planter fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Not for this price. ..
customer_reviews.text: They were much thinner then I expected but that wasn’t a deal breaker. Then, I put them on and moved around a bit. That was the deal breaker. Before I knew it the socks were rolling up my feet from my toes and tightly bunching up in the ankle. So, they were too loose in the foot and too tight in the ankle. For the price, I didn't think they were worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzu

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are much better for me than the knee highs I bought a while ago. In order for the knee highs to fit properly, I had to buy a much bigger size and they don't fit my foot very well...they're too big. But these socks are the right size and fits very snugly. When I took them off, suddenly I had an ankle again. Also they were delivered way ahead of when I was told they would be here. That's always a plus. I will order from this vender again when I need more product.
customer_reviews.author: Ginilynn

customer_reviews.title: 1 Yay and 1 Nay
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for my husband's foot pain, so 5 stars from him. He wears them whenever he gets a flare-up and they help him immediately. They didn't help me at all. I tried them on several different occasions but usually ended up pulling them off before morning because of discomfort. So 1 star from me. Overall combined score of 6 stars divided by 2 = 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: estrella90265

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Results
customer_reviews.text: Have suffered from a swollen foot and ankle since total knee replacement in November 2018. Docs advised wearing compression stockings, Ibuprofen (3 tabs, 3 times daily), plus ice. On going for months without favorable results. Received an email for a much more expensive competitive product creating interest, subsequent Amazon search, and ultimately this purchase two weeks ago. Fact; within TWO (2) days swelling was gone! I continue to wear as they bring comfort and continued relief from uncomfortable swelling. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Just1

customer_reviews.title: Wow - these relieved my PF pain.
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with plantar fasciitis after training in an inappropriate pair of shoes (my fault). I've been doing the regime haphazardly: stretching, exercising, icing. massaging. I really didn't want a boot for night time, so I got these compression socks. I did up my game in terms of following the regime plus I added the socks. I woke this morning with almost no pain when getting out of bed. What a difference from the stabbing pain I've been dealing with for weeks. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: ... socks after reading the reviews and i couldnt be HAPPIER! I wear the socks at work for 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these socks after reading the reviews and i couldnt be HAPPIER! I wear the socks at work for 10 hours and the pain in my right foot has got LOTS better. Not sure how or why it works but they DEFINITELY have made my everyday life BETTER!!! My foot hurts real bad in the morning but after i put these socks on and walk around a bit im ready to start my day! Cant wait to wear them golfing this week because i know my pain will not be there with these socks on!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tate

customer_reviews.title: Relieves pain and Planter fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These socks were better than expected. A great deal for the price. I suffer from plantar fasciitis bad. This really relieved the pain. I wear them at night while I sleep and sometimes during the day. Slim enough to wear under shoes. Only thing was I wish they made a bigger size for my daughter and husband. I bought a Xlarge and I wear a size 9 in women’s and they fit perfect. Not meant for any size larger unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: kim flowers

customer_reviews.title: Good for swelling
customer_reviews.text: I don't have plantar fasciitis. I bought these socks because I have swelling in my foot due to a healing fracture of one of my metatarsals. These work every bit as well as a knee high compression sock for keeping the swelling down while I'm on my feet all day and they are much easier to get on/off and less noticeable when wearing shorts/capri pants.
customer_reviews.author: KJB

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief - Really!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! They offer great compression while still being comfortable! Relief of my heal and plantar fasciitis pain were virtually instantaneous. Thank you for a great product. I recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mary

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wash them! They shrink!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I suffer from Plantars Fasciitis. I wore them once and thought they were great! I washed them in cool water and hung to dry. They shrunk! How? I don’t know. But they were too small and now sit in the trash waiting for Monday. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AM George

customer_reviews.title: Fits right
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and put it on immediately after receiving it. I bought my size but initially thought and even contacted the company as I thought it was not snug enough in the arch and heel. Was I wrong! The variable support in those areas and generally around the heel proofed out the longer I wore throughout the day. I feel the difference when I'm not wearing it. Perfect for plantar fasciitis sufferer.
customer_reviews.author: Perez

customer_reviews.title: These are the best socks for some added support!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for ankle support. I seem to twist my ankles frequently enough that I feel a little extra support will help. These socks are so comfortable! Not only do they help with supporting my ankles, they make my feet feel so much better at the end of the day. They are not thick, making shoes tight I will be ordering more of these again soon. Love Love Love these!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: This WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with Plantar Faciitis for nearly two months with no relief. Between that and a healing broken toe on my other foot, I was a mess. I caught a look of myself walking in the mirror and I looked like an old woman. I’m 41...no spring chicken, but I seriously looked OLD. Within a few minutes of putting this on, I was walking normally and was able to walk around and dance at a festival all that night. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Pamperin

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer, Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My ankle was severly injured, but not broken, in a car accident and the edema/swelling was incredible. I couldn't wear shoes for over a month. I was stuck w/the knee high, dr. prescribed compression socks for a month. They were very uncomfortable and too hot to wear in the middle of a very warm summer, so I ordered these. I am beyond happy with this product. They are very comfortable and don't make my feet sweat at all. I've been wearing them for a few weeks now and the edema/swelling is almost completely gone. They also provide a good bit of support. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole J Foss

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want compression pressure this sock is it. Goes on fairly easily and follow suggestion to order a size up for wider feet. Comfortable and light. Easily hand wash and air dry overnight Area around toes is banded so that there is not a pinching or squeexing in the toe area. Comfortable enough to sleep in . Fair price
customer_reviews.author: Proverb 31

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with thick calves
customer_reviews.text: These definitely work. My PF arch pain was significantly reduced wearing these. However, I cannot wear them for more than a few hours. Evidently my calves are too thick. The socks don’t stay up. (My coworker recommended these. Hers stay in place.) They wind up bunched up down at ankles, which produces too much pressure. Seller provided great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Porter

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical but so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this but I have had a bad case plantar fasciitis for nine months now so I am getting a little desperate. Purchased this along with a massage ball and new insoles for my shoes. I can immediately tell the difference these socks make. If being on my feet for two hours was tough, these made me feel like I could do four. They aren't curing it but make it more manageable to be on your feet a lot. My only concern is if they lose compression over time or they start to fray.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Fit is very comfortable once your feet get used to them
customer_reviews.text: Fit is very comfortable once your feet get used to them. They felt a little uncomfortable at first then the muscles in your feet learn to adapt to them and they just feel better and better after the muscles in your feet conform. I was having trouble with an ankle that I used to sprain all the time when I was younger. After wearing these for a week the clicking in that ankle has lessened and the pain has all but disappeared. Sure cost less than a doctors visit.
customer_reviews.author: B Whiteman

customer_reviews.title: Great help for Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear everyday for my plantar fasciitis. They have big a huge help with the pain while walking. I use these everyday. I put them on in the morning and then take them off at night. They have held up very well. Washing them has had no effect on them. I throw them in the wash and they come out like new. The compression they provide makes my feet feel great. Combined with nightly icing and a stretching program my feet are feeling so much better. I am not limited in my activities.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: foot size sizing DOES NOT equate to a leg size - if you have large legs or swelling these may not work for you
customer_reviews.text: I WANTED to love these but they are NOT made for people with large or swollen legs/edema. They felt wonderful when I put them on but quickly realized the foot size sizing DOES NOT equate to a leg size and unfortunately they cut my circulation off. I am going back to the full leg compression sock to eliminate this problem. I am giving them a 4 since I am sure if I had "small legs" they would be wonderful but want people to know that sizing is based on having skinny/thin legs like the ones in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: SunBurst

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful putting these socks on because of weak spots inherent in the design.
customer_reviews.text: Because I took off a star I will start with cons, really only one con but it is significant. Because of how the sock is designed with areas of thin material making up the brand logo part of the sock, one needs to be extremely careful putting these socks on. First time putting one on already have a tear where the compression material meets the thin line of the logo. Pros, compression is snug but comfortable. Noticed a difference in how my ankle felt immediately. Sock did not leave deep indents on my lower calf. Compression managed my edema very well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Sinkewjz

customer_reviews.title: Way too tight
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nurse and wear compression hose often. I bought these to help with the plantar fasciitis I have in one foot. I had no problem putting them one but within 2-3 hours my foot was throbbing. I do not have swelling problems outside of the usual ‘on your feet all day’ kind of swelling. My lower leg above this sock had a distinct line after removing the sock and I noticed no difference in my plantar fasciitis pain. If I had the original packaging for one I would return them.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Fit comfortably
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to put on. I wore it day and night the first time decided that was too long. Wore it just at night the second night. Wanted to take it off about 3 in the morning, but I'm handicapped and was not able to. I wore it just for the day the third day, but needed it off after 4 hours. Hubby has to help take it off. My left foot is swollen from a stroke, but I think for a normal planters fasciitis this would work nicely. Felt very comfortable for the first 12 hours worn.
customer_reviews.author: Pat N

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Durability?  Hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these socks and have been using one pair for less than 2 weeks, only during my daily 2-hour workout. The socks provide good compression, but today I have already noticed fraying at the top seam which is not good. I wonder if they are going to last a month or not. Disappointed. 03/28/2019 - Updated my rating from 2 to 4 stars. The fraying did not get any worse so it looks like the product will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Friday

customer_reviews.title: Different size for double set
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered a set of black compression socks and liked them so I ordered a double set, pink and black, same medium size. They are not as compression as the first pair I bought which is unfortunate. I need the support bc i have plantar fasciitis and need these to help me sleep and relieve pain.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: 3 of us
customer_reviews.text: I bought both small and medium and I am a 7.5 womens, the small is a bit too tight. I bought these because of my arch pain from being on my feet all day. My daughter wears the small, shes a size 4Y and she does dance 10 hours a week and she said it helps with her foot pain as well. My husband is a size 10 boot, I bought him an XL, he has plantar faciities and works on roofs all day and says it helps him too.
customer_reviews.author: Genine Burnet

customer_reviews.title: Socks are labled only for right & left foot
customer_reviews.text: Socks work great when you need your toes open for certain shoes. My only problem was I needed it for just the right foot due to an injury. They are Imprinted R & L for right/left foot. When I tried to use both socks on the same foot I felt pain in the ankle area. Previous review said to get your shoe size but my opinion is if your foot is very swollen you might want to get a pair a little bit bigger and as the swelling goes down then get your shoe size. My foot was so swollen I could not get it on With my shoe size till it went down.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah P.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my brother whose job requires him to be on his feet all day. He developed some foot issues and a foot doctor recommended a costly procedure that may or may not have helped. I took a chance and suggested my brother try these. He loves them. He wears them to work every day under his regular socks and the severe pain at the end of the day is gone--he gets a mild ache now and then which is alleviated with a foot soak!
customer_reviews.author: Nawn

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I love these. The compression is just what I need. I can't even walk without these. Due to a blown Planter Fascists, I have no arch. My foot is so flat that my midfoot is starting to become stressed when I walk. It causes sever pain when I walk. These compression socks hold my foot tight so the bones don't bend under the stress of my weight. It holds my foot tight enough that I do not experience as much pain but it is also still comfortable to wear. I have about worn my pair out and I will order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Will roll up on your feet at a moments notice
customer_reviews.text: Not really seeing a bit of difference when I wear these. I possess ankle braces/supports that are the same design except an open heel that are a little bit more sturdier. One issue I have with these is that they tend to roll up from the front toward the back of my foot every time I wear them. When this happens I think I have something in my shoe. Super annoying if you're a runner or wear these in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve suffered from my plantar fasciitis for several months and seemed to be getting worse everyday. In just a couple of days using these socks, I am now totally pain free! I also tried to lose about 10 lbs through effortless diet which may have also helped. Off and on, I still put the socks on at night if I feel some tenderness on my heel and by the next day, I don’t feel any discomfort again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Provide adequate compression
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after another brand purchased on Amazon didn’t fit as described and provided very little support for my ankle (partial tears to both peroneal tendons). These are a major improvement. Not only do they not cover my toes like the others did which I found uncomfortable with the other ones (size 7.5 foot wearing a medium), they provide decent compression without being too tight. My foot doc sold me sleeves that provide more compression, but they’re heavier and my foot gets hot in them. These are lighter weight and a great wear while I wash and dry the ones from my doc or when it’s warm.
customer_reviews.author: awolphyone

customer_reviews.title: I am now a believer!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical these would help, but in my delirious foot pain I ordered a pair. Holy cow, it doesn't feel like there's a cow standing on my foot anymore! Never knew so much relief could come from a foot sleeve. I wash about twice a week - these seem to not absorb a lot of odor - and I avoid throwing them in the dryer, and the elastic compression seems as tight as the day they arrived. Five freaking stars!
customer_reviews.author: R Long

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get on
customer_reviews.text: Not only were they extremely hard to get on, they fit so snug the circulation was cut off. Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine G.

customer_reviews.title: They work....
customer_reviews.text: These socks help to keep your foot in a position which is better at keeping your leg muscle extended. When it is in a relaxed position too long it tightness up and has a hard time stretching in the morning. Wearing these helped to heal my plantar fasciitis. I have stopped wearing them until the first sign of returned discomfort, I will put them back on. Thank you for making these. Also, they are tight but not too tight for what your foot needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Relief!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe what a difference these have made. During the week before and after my recent move, I was on my feet a lot wearing flat shoes. I have a high arch, and the resulting foot pain was almost unbearable. This caused limping, which aggravated my right knee and my sciatica. I wore these socks continuously after I got them, and the relief was almost immediate. I now wear them periodically (in the evenings or when I feel the pain return), and they offer immediate relief. I have told my chiropractor and primary physician about them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline D. White

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: I've had some heel pain from plantar faciitis (PF) and was looking for something to provide relief for days when I'm on my feet a lot. I've been using these PF socks for about a week and they have definitely helped. They are quite snug, which gives good support in the arch. I wear them under regular socks and if I just pull them on, the toe end of these PF has a tendency to roll, so I'm careful about rolling on my regular socks to avoid this. They are not so tight as to impair circulation though. I'm quite happy with my purchase and will buy again if I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, they really help.
customer_reviews.text: After only one day use, can walk almost painfree, ankle and arch supported firmly. Highly recommend socks, will buy again. My severely fallen arch affected my ankle and calf, probably even caused backpain, made walking painful and awkward. Tried many other socks before, never found relief. These socks work like a brace, but are flexible, comfortable. I am happy and grateful to have found them. Thank you for a product that does live up to the advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Nice as socks, but too lightweight for support of plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I love compression sleeves for the feet. A sturdier, more supportive brand for PF is BeVisible. The BV compression socks are just as good 18 months later as when new, and I wear them most days. TheThirty 48 Plantar Fasciitis Compression Socks are around-the-house socks--not for walking and standing.
customer_reviews.author: xenamama

customer_reviews.title: Raynauds sufferers can benefit from this product as well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband who has a circulatory condition called Raynauds which affects his hand and feet when exposed to cold temperatures. These compression socks do help his condition and definitely increases his circulation when wearing these. I plan on telling his doctor about these as my idea to try these paid off. His color in his feet looks better and overall surface temperatures are warmer due to the compression of these stronger mmHg socks. Time will tell on the longevity of this product
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief
customer_reviews.text: These were wonderful and I have had so much ankle pain and they brought me comfort almost instantly but will have to wait and see how they hold up after wearing them all day but so far I LOVE these! Have a ankle wrap brace that is too thick to wear comfortably all day with shoes but this is amazing and so happy I found it. Looking forward to hopefully to having pain free ankles especially at work on my feet all day (medical field)
customer_reviews.author: Jeannep

customer_reviews.title: Great for third trimester pregnancy.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought two more of the compression socks. I'm in my third trimester and experiencing the swelling feet a lot. I like these because I can wear them with my work shoes and sandals. They are comfortable and breathable. I have a different set of compression socks and I like these better. I have small feet but I would recommend buying a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed. I expected it to be snug to give my ankles real support. Unfortunately they’re like socks kinda loose fitting even though I bought a size small. I have weak ankles and needed the support. Unfortunately, I can’t return them since I actually wore them.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: Good product, be cautious of sizing chart.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading the reviews, but most of the time when I receive a product it works for me and the reviews aren’t the same for me . These are a bit hard to get on but after all they are “compression “ socks. By the chart I should have ordered a medium, but I went with my gut and ordered a large. I’m glad I did . Like the product and it does the job .
customer_reviews.author: D Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy pricy prescription socks
customer_reviews.text: These are almost exactly the same socks I received from a pricy medical store with exactly the compressor prescribed for me and they were less than half the cost. Medicare does not cover these and only some insurance policies do. I can't promise pain relief or swelling will decrease for all but both certainly were cured for me.
customer_reviews.author: net shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit small and the material is thin. Within 2 days of having them when I pulled them on my nail went through the fabric and they ripped. I have short nails and never had the happen before. Plus they roll up from the toe area making them uncomfortable to wear. I should have just thrown my money away versus ordering them
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ankle compress socks for my Post-OP leg procedure. The socks was purchased along with rootless thigh high compression stockings. The socks are comfortable, flexible and non restricting of circulation to my toes. My Doctor was very impressed with the socks and stocking. He stated he will recommend the Compression Socks to his patients.
customer_reviews.author: Lorneater

product_meta.title: Thirty48 Plantar Fasciitis Compression Socks(1 or 2 Pairs), 20-30 mmHg Foot Compression Sleeves for Ankle/Heel Support, Increase Blood Circulation, Relieve Arch Pain, Reduce Foot Swelling
feature_bullets: ✅ Engineered with Stretchy Ultra Light Fabric - These socks provide fast comfortable relief from plantar fasciitis pain. Fully elastic design is unobtrusive in everyday life and does not restrict movement allowing men and women to wear these sleeves while working or exercising in leisure.

✅ 20-30 mmHg Pressure Compression ergonomically conforms to your foot for a tight fit around nerves and muscles to increase circulation and reduce inflammation. Can also aid in recovery from edema and heel spurs. Also helps strengthen the foot to prevent future muscle injuries.
✅ Strong protection at the ankle and foot helps force balance to prevent twits and sprains caused by excessive forces.

✅ (75% Nylon, 25% Spandex) Comfortable enough to wear with anything (sandals, slippers, sneakers, formal shoes, heels) or even under socks. Thin, breathable, and moisture wicking, these provide ankle spur arch support without getting wet even through the most intense workouts.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
